sect2.title: Configuring Glibc
sect2.para: We need to create the /etc/nsswitch.conf file. Although glibc should provide defaults when this file is missing or corrupt, it's defaults don't work well with networking which will be dealt with in a later chapter. Also, our timezone needs to be setup.
Create a new file /etc/nsswitch.conf by running the following:
sect2.literallayout:
cat > /etc/nsswitch.conf << "EOF" # Begin /etc/nsswitch.conf
passwd: files group: files shadow: files
publickey: files
hosts: files dns networks: files
protocols: db files services: db files ethers: db files rpc: db files
netgroup: db files
# End /etc/nsswitch.conf EOF
sect2.para: The tzselect script has to be run and the questions regarding the user's timezone have to be answered. When the user is done, the script will give the location of the needed timezone file.
tzselect's output can be something like EST5EDT or Canada/Eastern.
